definition[0]: a sale of goods at a lower price because they have been slightly damaged by a fire, or of goods that cannot be stored because of a fire
definition[1]: an occasion when someone sells something at a very low price because they need the money very quickly
example[0]: Bankruptcy could lead to a fire sale, with creditors receiving a smaller dividend.
example[1]: Stores have resorted to fire sale tactics this month because they have more inventory than they want.
